intro: Eriospermum ramosum, commonly known as the branched eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually linear and grayish-green, with a fuzzy texture. The showy yellow flowers appear in spring and are followed by distinctive, woolly seed heads that aid in wind dispersal.
